document.title: OHIO’S LEARNING STANDARDS | Social Studies | ADOPTED 2018

2F8650A2BE61437BA0BB981369005574.description: Environmental concerns, impacted by population growth and heightened by international competition for the world’s energy supplies, have resulted in a new environmental consciousness and a movement for the sustainability of the world’s resources.

41F8755D14E844A28E7495B4ECEA17E9.description: The rapid increase of global population, coupled with an increase in life expectancy and mass migrations have created societal and governmental challenges.

93AD9343A5A94A209292457868827B7E.description: Proliferation of nuclear weapons has created a challenge to world peace.

4CF80D74D46F4A84ACCC3D87DE893CB5.description: Emerging economic powers and improvements in technology have created a more interdependent global economy.

07EC0D2EC1F6499580C01658B9821E30.description: Political and cultural groups have struggled to achieve selfgovernance and self-determination.

1EF7A644E7B04699BD8D98F60B7C2B59.description: Regional and ethnic conflicts in the post-Cold War era have resulted in acts of terrorism, genocide and ethnic cleansing.

DC80EA03A0B641EC88A811C0CBE11436.description: The break-up of the Soviet Union ended the Cold War and created challenges for its former allies, the former Soviet republics, Europe, the United States and the non-aligned world.

1BB206DD7F31476AA76D378E01E5A9A8.description: GLOBALIZATION (1991-PRESENT) The global balance of power shifted with the end of the Cold War. Wars, territorial disputes, ethnic and cultural conflicts, acts of terrorism, advances in technology, expansion of human rights, and changes in the global economy present new challenges.

C57ECC631CE54DDEAEE0EE1F30663D18.description: Political and social struggles have resulted in expanded rights and freedoms for women and indigenous peoples.

3A371A7B90B041309ED12B28F1889B09.description: Postwar global politics led to the rise of nationalist movements in Africa and Southeast Asia.

4EB268A2F4C647898DD09FAB814F7CCF.description: Religious diversity, the end of colonial rule and rising nationalism have led to regional conflicts in the Middle East.

283B031ACF144A91907DCC98E306862E.description: Treaties and agreements at the end of World War II changed national boundaries and created multinational organizations.

76F00D75DCDE4D8EACE133911EDB2E80.description: The United States and the Soviet Union became superpowers and competed for global influence.

F419EBB0274E486E90EBF547C6FF5BC1.description: THE COLD WAR (1945-1991) Conflicting political and economic ideologies after World War II resulted in the Cold War. The Cold War overlapped with the era of decolonization and national liberation

468BD6F785A5453D92F0745B1584B2C6.description: World War II devastated most of Europe and Asia, led to the occupation of Eastern Europe and Japan, and began the atomic age.

ECEBD42585DB4645916C046450980846.description: Oppression and discrimination resulted in the Armenian Genocide during World War I and the Holocaust during World War II.

4F713AEF49F7456E9D8BE68AFBEABAA1.description: The consequences of World War I and the worldwide depression set the stage for the Russian Revolution, the rise of totalitarianism, aggressive Axis expansion and the policy of appeasement which in turn led to World War II.

BAD5D92F56A04F2AB338C7D539CF43A5.description: The causes of World War I included militarism, imperialism, nationalism and alliances.

946237C8014A497883D4A1A0BFD4DB5D.description: Advances in technology, communication and transportation improved lives, but also had negative consequences.

C6A1DFE3F37F4C298379A716EADF9E2E.description: ACHIEVEMENTS AND CRISES (1900-1945) The first half of the 20th century was one of rapid technological advances. It was a period when the tensions between industrialized nations resulted in World War I and set the stage for World War II. While World War II transformed the balance of world power, it was the  most destructive and costly war in terms of human casualties and material resources expended.

DCFD5104C03E42DF9273930920B52DAD.description: The consequences of imperialism were viewed differently by the colonizers and the colonized.

01F50ED4774543A59F8A606A8A575EC0.description: Imperialism involved land acquisition, extraction of raw materials, spread of Western values and direct political control.

577EC53F2D134256A65D4BD55F54B16A.description: Imperial expansion had political, economic and social roots.

D357A0B33D0F4ED797A9376884DDC9A0.description: IMPERIALISM (1800-1914) The industrialized nations embarked upon a competition for overseas empires that had profound implications for the entire world. This “new imperialism” focused on the underdeveloped world and led to the domination and exploitation of Asia, Africa and Latin America.

B0E867B73EA945E1841C5A4469E1C0F5.description: Industrialization had social, political and economic effects on Western Europe and the world.

FCEED4A3CD2C4293B48AE40BA85684C8.description: The American and French Revolutions influenced Latin American revolutions for independence.

355858E6D991484BA459F17DF9D13198.description: AGE OF REVOLUTIONS (1750-1914) The Age of Revolutions was a period of two world-encompassing and interrelated developments: the democratic revolution and the industrial revolution. Both had political, economic and social consequences on a global scale.

AE480AF6B22A4C07A3B0C126CA6D5854.description: Enlightenment ideas on the relationship of the individual and the government influenced the American and French Revolutions.

598C7C46FF7149D3BCC3DAB90FE1AB6C.description:
Enlightenment ideas regarding human nature and society 
challenged religious authority, absolute rule and mercantilism.

5A9F02437469484186739C58D6BC182B.description: The Scientific Revolution impacted religious, political, and cultural institutions by challenging how people viewed the world.

085CEE8B65F74462ADFC32BA6F12529D.description: AGE OF ENLIGHTENMENT (1600-1800) The Age of Enlightenment developed from the Scientific Revolution of the 16th and 17th centuries. A new focus on reasoning was used to understand social, political and economic institutions.

E039B0BAA52F4F9FBAEA8EF3BE226B4D.description: Historians analyze cause, effect, sequence, and correlation in historical events, including multiple causation and long- and short-term causal relations.

67D3D65CC22F45F2B55064B120DC754F.description: Historians develop theses and use evidence to support or refute positions.

9211B3B54A794A3B9F5AAC2456618474.description: The use of primary and secondary sources of information includes an examination of the credibility of each source.

1C21D882EDA2468E827AD9E54A709D20.description: HISTORICAL THINKING AND SKILLS - Students apply skills by utilizing a variety of resources to construct theses and support or refute contentions made by others. Alternative explanations of historical events are analyzed and questions of historical inevitability are explored.
